children.name: Brain
children.definition: The central processor responsible for cognition, memory, and voluntary motor control.

children.name: Cerebrum
children.definition: The largest part of the brain, responsible for high-level functions like thought and action.

children.name: Cerebellum
children.definition: Coordinates voluntary movements such as posture, balance, and coordination.

children.name: Brainstem
children.definition: Regulates vital cardiac and respiratory functions and maintains consciousness.

children.name: Spinal Cord
children.definition: The main pathway for information connecting the brain and peripheral nervous system.

children.name: Peripheral Nerves
children.definition: A network of nerves extending outside the central nervous system to the limbs and organs.

children.name: Heart
children.definition: A muscular pump that circulates blood throughout the entire body.

children.name: Blood Vessels
children.definition: A vast network of tubes that carry blood to and from all parts of the body.

children.name: Arteries
children.definition: Vessels that carry oxygen-rich blood away from the heart.

children.name: Veins
children.definition: Vessels that return deoxygenated blood back to the heart.

children.name: Capillaries
children.definition: Tiny vessels where the exchange of water, oxygen, and nutrients occurs.

children.name: Lungs
children.definition: The primary organs of respiration where gas exchange takes place.

children.name: Bronchi
children.definition: The main passageways that carry air into the lungs.

children.name: Alveoli
children.definition: Tiny air sacs where oxygen and carbon dioxide are exchanged.

children.name: Trachea
children.definition: Commonly known as the windpipe, it provides airflow to and from the lungs.

children.name: Larynx
children.definition: Also called the voice box, it protects the lower airways and houses the vocal cords.

children.name: Stomach
children.definition: A muscular organ that contains acids and enzymes to break down food.

children.name: Liver
children.definition: The largest internal organ, responsible for detoxification and protein synthesis.

children.name: Pancreas
children.definition: Produces important enzymes and hormones like insulin for digestion and sugar regulation.

children.name: Intestines
children.definition: The portion of the digestive tract responsible for nutrient and water absorption.

children.name: Small Intestine
children.definition: Where 90% of the digestion and absorption of food occurs.

children.name: Duodenum
children.definition: The first section of the small intestine where most chemical digestion takes place.

children.name: Jejunum
children.definition: The middle part of the small intestine specialized for absorption.

children.name: Ileum
children.definition: The final section of the small intestine which absorbs B12 and bile salts.

children.name: Large Intestine
children.definition: Responsible for absorbing water from the remaining indigestible food matter.

children.name: Colon
children.definition: The main part of the large intestine where water and salts are absorbed.

children.name: Rectum
children.definition: The final straight portion of the large intestine where waste is stored.

children.name: Axial Skeleton
children.definition: The part of the skeleton that consists of the bones of the head and trunk.

children.name: Skull
children.definition: Bony structure that forms the head and surrounds the brain.

children.name: Spine
children.definition: Flexible column of vertebrae protecting the spinal cord.

children.name: Rib Cage
children.definition: Bony frame of the thorax that protects the heart and lungs.

children.name: Appendicular Skeleton
children.definition: Includes the bones of the shoulder girdle, pelvic girdle, and limbs.

children.name: Upper Limbs
children.definition: The arms and hands used for manipulation and reaching.

children.name: Lower Limbs
children.definition: The legs and feet used for support and mobility.

children.name: Femur
children.definition: The thigh bone, the longest and strongest bone in the body.

children.name: Tibia
children.definition: The shinbone, the larger of the two bones in the lower leg.

children.name: Skeletal Muscle
children.definition: Striated muscles connected to bones that allow voluntary movement.

children.name: Smooth Muscle
children.definition: Involuntary muscles found in the walls of internal organs.

children.name: Cardiac Muscle
children.definition: The unique involuntary muscle found only in the heart.

children.name: Kidneys
children.definition: Filtering organs that remove waste and extra water from the blood.

children.name: Bladder
children.definition: A muscular sac that stores urine until it is excreted.

children.name: Pituitary
children.definition: Often called the master gland, it controls many other endocrine glands.

children.name: Thyroid
children.definition: Produces hormones that regulate the body's metabolic rate.

children.name: Adrenals
children.definition: Produce hormones that help regulate metabolism and response to stress.

children.name: Spleen
children.definition: An organ that filters blood and plays a key role in the immune system.

children.name: Lymph Nodes
children.definition: Small structures that filter foreign substances from the lymphatic fluid.

children.name: Male System
children.definition: Organs involved in the production of sperm and male hormones.

children.name: Female System
children.definition: Organs involved in the production of eggs and female hormones.

children.name: Uterus
children.definition: The womb, where a fetus develops during pregnancy.

children.name: Ovaries
children.definition: Produce eggs and hormones like estrogen.
